gurmukhi: ਸੋਭਤ ਕੇਸਰ ਅੰਗ ਡਰਾਯੋ || ਅਾਨੰਦ ਹੀੲੇ ੳੁਛਰ ਜਨ ਅਾਯੋ ||੧੬੩||
transliteration: Sobhat Kesat An Daraayo|| Aanand Heee Oucchar Jan Aayo||163
translation: The saffron sprinkled on the limbs appeared like the bliss gushing forth form the heart.163.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜਤ ਭੲੇ ਅਮਿਤ ਚਤੁਰੰਗਾ || ੳੁਮੰਡ ਚਲਤ ਜਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਕਰਿ ਗੰਗਾ ||
transliteration: Saajat Bhae Amit Cchaturanad|| Oumand Chalet Jih Bidh(i) Kar(i) Gadgad||
translation: They are gathering their limitless fourfold army like the gushing forth of the Ganges.

gurmukhi: ਭਲ ਭਲ ਕੁਅਰ ਚੜੇ ਸਜ ਸੈਨਾ || ਕੋਟਕ ਚੜੇ ਸੂਰ ਜਨੁ ਗੈਨਾ ||੧੬੪||
transliteration: Bhal Bhal Kuar Chade Saj Sainaa|| Kotak Chade Soor Jan(u) Gadnaa||164||
translation: With their armed forces the princes appear glorious like millions of suns in the sky.164.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਥ ਸਹਿਤ ਸੋਭਤ ਸਭ ਭ੍ਰਾਤਾ || ਕਹਿ ਨ ਪਰਤ ਮੁਖ ਤੇ ਕਛੁ ਬਾਤਾ ||
transliteration: Bharath Sahit Sobhat Sabh Bhraataa|| Kah(i) Na Parat Moukh Te Kachh(i) Baataa||
translation: All the brothers blongwith Bharat seem in such splendour which cannot be described.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤਨ ਮਨ ਸੁੰਦਨ ਸੁਤ ਮੋਹੈਂ || ਜਨੁ ਦਿਤ ਗ੍ਹ ਰਵਿ ਸਸ ਦੋੳੂ ਸੋਹੈਂ ||੧੬੫||
transliteration: Maatan Man Soundar Sout Mohain|| Jan(u) Dit Grah Rav(i) Sas Dooo Sohain||165||
translation: The beautiful princes are alluring the minds of their mothers and appear like the sun and moon born in the house of Diti, increasing its magnificence.165.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧ ਕੈ ਸਜ ਸੁੱਧ ਬਰਾਤਾ || ਕਛੁ ਨ ਪਰਤ ਕਹਿ ਤਿਨ ਕੀ ਬਾਤਾ ||
transliteration: Eh Bidh Kai Saj Suddh Baraataa|| Kachh(u) Na Parat Kah(i) Tin Kibaataa||
translation: In this way the beautiful wedding parties were emblished. Which are indescribable;

gurmukhi: ਬਾਢਤ ਕਹਤ ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਬਾਤਨ ਕਰ || ਬਿਦਾ ਹੋਨ ਸਿਸ ਚਲੇ ਤਾਤ ਘਰ ||੧੬੬||
transliteration: Baadhat Kahat Granth Baatan Kar|| Bidaa Hon Sis Chale Taat Ghar||166||
translation: By saying all this the volume of the book will be increased And all these children moved towards the place of their father for getting his permission to depart.166.

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿ ਪਿਤਾ ਕਹੁ ਕੀਨ ਪ੍ਰਨਾਮਾ || ਜੋਰ ਪਾਨ ਠਾਢੇ ਬਨ ਧਾਮਾ ||
transliteration: Aae Pitaa Kauh Keen Pranaamaa|| Jor Paan Thaadhe Ban Dhaamaa||
translation: They ll came and bowed before their father and stood there with folded hands.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਖ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਅਾਨੰਦ ਮਨ ਭਰੇ || ਦਾਨ ਬਹੁਤ ਬਿੱਪਨ ਕਹ ਕਰੇ ||੧੬੭||
transliteration: Nirakh Poutra Aanand Man Bhare|| Daan Bahout Bippan Kah Dare||167||
translation: The king was filled with joy on seeing his sons and he gave many things in charity to the Brahmins.167.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਤ ਮਾਤ ਲੈ ਕੰਠਿ ਲਗਾੲੇ || ਜਨ ਦੁੲਿ ਰਤਨ ਨਿਰਧਨੀ ਪਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Taat Maat Lai Kanth(i) Lagade|| Jan Due Rattan Nirdhanipaae||
translation: Hugging their children to their bosom the parents felt great pleasure like a poor man on acquiring the gems.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਦਾ ਮਾਂਗ ਜਬ ਗੲੇ ਰਾਮ ਘਰ || ਸੀਸ ਰਹੇ ਧਰ ਚਰਨ ਕਮਲ ਪਰ ||੧੬੮||
transliteration: Bidaa Maan Jah Gad Raam Ghar|| Sees Rahe Dhar Charan Kamal Par||168||
translation: After taking permission for departure they reached the place of Ram and bowed their on his feet.168.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਬਿਦਾ ਕਰੇ ਸਿਰ ਚੂਮਯੋ ਪਾਨ ਪੀਠ ਧਰੇ ਅਾਨਦ ਸੋ ਭਰੇ ਲੈ ਤੰਬੋਰ ਅਾਗੇ ਧਰੇ ਹੈਂ ||
transliteration: Raam Bidaa Dare Sir Choomo Paan Peeth Ddare Aanad So Bhare Lai Tanbor Aage Ddare Hain||
translation: Ram kissed the heads of all and placed his hand on their back with love, He presented with betel leaf etc. and affectionately bade them farewell.

gurmukhi: ਦੁੰਦਭੀ ਬਜਾੲਿ ਤੀਨੋ ਭਾੲੀ ਯੌ ਚਲਤ ਭੲੇ ਮਾਨੋ ਸੂਰ ਚੰਦ ਕੋਟਿ ਅਾਨ ਅਵਤਰੇ ਹੈਂ ||
transliteration: Doundabhibajaae Teeno Bhaaiyau Chalet Bhae Aanad So Bhare Lai Tanbor Aage Ddare Hain||
translation: Playing on the drums and the musical instruments all the people moved as if millions of suns and moons have manifested on the earth.
